content.p: Professor of Hepatology, Faculty of Medicine & Health Sciences Drug-induced liver injury (DILI): Genetic and environmental factors associated with drug-induced liver injury, non-invasive markers to detect and monitor hepatotoxicity. Metabolic liver diseases: Interaction of dietary and genetic factors in the pathogenesis, non-invasive detection and stratification of metabolic dysfunction and alcohol related steatotic liver diseases, interventions to prevent and resolve steatohepatitis. Technology for life: Magnetic resonance imaging and spectroscopy to evaluate metabolic physiology, pathobiology and its consequences. Advanced imaging and interventions in the pancreatico-biliary tract. Prof Aithal is an Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy (2019). He has been an invited faculty for post-graduate course in Europe, USA, Asia and Africa.
